abstract: The earnings show the potential for growth but also the steep challenges facing AT&T and other telephone companies.
snippet: The earnings show the potential for growth but also the steep challenges facing AT&T and other telephone companies.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, April 24 — AT&T, the world’s largest telephone company, reported first-quarter earnings on Tuesday that handily beat Wall Street expectations. But some investors and telecommunications industry analysts said they were not sure that AT&T could continue its pace, particularly as growth is slowing in the mobile phone business.

headline.main: AT&T Earnings Beat Forecasts Despite Slow Market for Mobile Phones
headline.print_headline: AT&T Earnings Beat Forecasts Despite Slow Market for Mobile Phones

abstract: The earnings show the potential for growth but also the steep challenges facing AT&T and other telephone companies.
snippet: The earnings show the potential for growth but also the steep challenges facing AT&T and other telephone companies.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, April 24 — AT&T Inc., the world’s largest telephone company, reported first-quarter earnings on Tuesday that handily beat Wall Street expectations. But some investors and telecommunications industry analysts said they were not sure that AT&T could continue its pace, particularly as growth is slowing in the mobile phone business.
